title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 586.6 - Information required of applicants
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 586.6 - Information required of applicants

State Regulations
(a) The agency may require an applicant to
include as a part of any application or other required filing such reasonable
information, including a completed environmental assessment form, as is
necessary to assist it in: (1)
determining
whether an action is exempt or excluded; (2)
determining whether an action may have a
significant effect on the environment; (3)
determining whether other agencies, including Federal agencies, have jurisdiction over the action or any portion of
it; or
(4)
preparation of an
environmental impact statement, if required, and if prepared by the
agency. (b) No
application or submission pursuant to section 814 of the Adirondack Park Agency

Act, or any other statute or regulation, shall be considered complete until
such information is submitted. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
586.6

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
